Making the Lessons Practical 

     Let the teachers enter, heart and soul, into the subject matter of the lesson. Let them lay plans to make 
                                                                           114
a practical application of the lesson, and awaken an interest in the minds and hearts of the children under their charge. Let the activities of the scholars find scope in solving the problems of Bible truth. The teachers may give character to the work, so that the exercises will not be dry and uninteresting.
